urls.title: Incidents
urls.description: Cheshire Fire and Rescue Service - We work 24 hours a day to keep Cheshire safe from fires and other emergencies.

tweets.text:
Yesterday firefighters were called to two incidents on the M6 Southbound J17. One involved a leak from a fuel tanker following a collision and the other was a collision involving a van and LGV. https://t.co/kEHUb4P8Qn

The road is now open. @HighwaysNWEST @NWmwaypolice https://t.co/4lpBXqsuz6

We think it's important the public is told when the most serious river pollution incidents occur. 
We want the @EnvAgencySE alerts for the Lea, Brent, Crane, Roding, Colne etc. to continue. 
Sign up to help stop the service ending in March:

tweets.text:
Green finance is just one way we can protect our environment.

Our ¬£10m Natural Environment Investment Readiness Fund will help do just that.

If you‚Äôre an organisation planning a project that will protect nature, then apply now:  
https://t.co/rWe4lzm11j 

#TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/wGNCKGKuxv
@TimWorfolk @JoKingDevon @EnvAgencySW @DevonLiveNews Between 8&11 each day. Very precise run off üòä

@BikeAndBoatUK @CRTContactUs @EnvAgency @RSPCA_official Unfortunately we do not cover the Milton Keynes area but these swans do need help. Please check on https://t.co/6ZJlU1HeCY to find the nearest wildlife rescue centre.

Good work from @EnvAgencyMids fisheries enforcement officers.

Illegal nets threaten fish stocks and other wildlife. If you see anything similar, please report it to us on 0800 80 70 60.

Funded by #rodlicence income. https://t.co/ekKAHKFPNs

We've closed the Rothbury flood gates due to rising water levels on the River Coquet. There may be a small amount of leakage observed as the gates are in operation so we have also put up temporary flood barriers to offer additional protection to homes and businesses #floodaware https://t.co/WojeiTonQV
We‚Äôre aware of a foam substance washing through the River Spen at Cleckheaton in West Yorks. We are investigating and monitoring the impacts on the watercourse. https://t.co/zKrEnoiyjN
@_erica_lewis @EnvAgencyNW Our pleasure! Once again... routine #maintenance is just as important as building new things. #assetmanagement

üéâToday's the day! It's great to be one of the partners involved in the @dorsetprepared online #winter event with @EnvAgencySW. We're running 3 sessions for #Dorset #flood wardens & community volunteers today & tomorrow. Find out more & book your place: https://t.co/fQ06Eb59XA https://t.co/d140vqhLdR

Afternoon @AndynBrown16 bumped into a couple of @EnvAgencyNW people clearing buddleias from the flood wall on New Quay Road. tweets.text:
Our Fisheries Enforcement officers are out whatever the weather to check on cases of illegal #fishing

Today they're patrolling the #Rugeley #Staffordshire area. No anglers spotted at Wade Lake.

It‚Äôs easy to buy a rod fishing licence online: https://t.co/bWOXzpUpYq

#GetFishing https://t.co/IQOWOVPxzx

Check out our interactive house! Discover how to make your home more resistant and resilient to flooding with tips, hints and product information about property flood resilience measures: https://t.co/bNhSPJBxCy
#BeFloodReady @DevComsTogether @CwllCFloodForum @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/RrY1Tnwb3K

Following recent heavy rain and snow melt, water levels are high on the upper River Coquet in the Caistron Lakes area.  More information is available here https://t.co/4A5hmGlqJl https://t.co/TVQGnFP7XP

We are taking measures to minimise the risk of flooding to communities around Rothbury and will be closing the flood gates. For advice and support on how to protect your home in the event of a flood, contact Floodline‚ÄØfor advice and support on 0345 988 1188‚ÄØ#floodaware

We've issued a flood alert for the Upper River Coquet due to rising temperatures causing snow melt, resulting in higher levels. The river has recently changed course into Caistron Lakes and we continue to monitor the situation. 
Check your flood risk here: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/SvGThNb8fb

urls.title: Omnishambles - Mark Avery
urls.description: Have you ever had a colleague at work who promises everything but consistently delivers work which is of poor quality and usually arrives late too? They‚Äô re the worst aren‚Äô t they? They may be well-meaning, they may be the life and soul of the party and great fun socially but they are a total waste of space as far as the work environment is concerned. Over-promising and under-delivering work colleagues tend not to stay around for long. DEFRA reminds me of those colleagues. The problem is that we are

tweets.text:
DEFRA's approach to the environment is an omnishambles, but it is merely a case study in the wider government omnishambles https://t.co/zIJtjimuG0

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Springwatch
entity.description: Following the fortunes of a cast of unforgettable wildlife characters at the climax of spring.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
